reviewText:
Early Access Review

Originally I posted that the game made me sick due to framerate issues and that the game would quit after you hit the start button on an XB360 controller.

The controller issues have been fixed and the framerate is a bit more optimized, but the game itself is super lame.

The game is really bland and boring. The voice acting is mediocre at best and there is no solid gameplay. The animations in the game are poorly done, for example, the fire spell" cuts off immediately as soon as you lift the button
date: and there is no level structure. You can visit a few places with no context of where you are. This feels like it truly is still just someone's project for fun and not polished enough to even be on Steam.\n\nI regret this purchase."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I regret buying this game.
although it was cheap.. i feel ripped off.
This is no better than the free demos you would find on
the oculus rift sharing page for free.
Lots of bugs and unpolished animations and effects.
Voicework is sub standard and no mouth sync.
Textures and sound is terrible.

On the positive side. Some of the terrain is quite beautiful.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game is bad! Wish I could get my $10 back.

First the good about it:
- It can be pretty in parts

The bad:
- Horrible voice acting, controls are bad, you won't know what to do almost all of the time and get lost / frustrated.
- Motion Sick? Not all the time, but with jerky camera movements and some bad fly by camera area's you will get motion sick.
- Don't buy this game, this is an example of bad VR.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Rift's Cave is an ambitious project which favors the total immersion of the player in a treated and evocative virtual fantasy world.
Getting lost in the green valleys, snow-covered lands or explore deep dungeons is a unique experience with RC and a good oculus!
I recommend everyone this adventure.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Unplayable Eye Candy (at this point).
All I can say is it looks good but does not play right.  The centering of Oculus doesn't work so this causes issues right from the start. Movement is awkward to say the least and, after less than 10 minuets in the game graphical artifacts occluded my view so much that I just gave up and quit.

I wish I didn't spend my money on this and it should be considered pre-alpha but, I do hope that it improves because some of what I saw looked good.

I'm gameface so I will be uploading a video of my playing experience for others to judge for themselves.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sZF9rrVv8Tk&list=UUMc9vxo5NN-yMIkAecJ87Bg

reviewText:
Early Access Review

OK so for full disclosure my system specs are not up to snuff to play this game.
1) ATI (OK AMD) 4650 is not enough to get decent frame rates even on fastest @1280x720
2) I don't have an oculus ... I do have an antique stereoscope ... and a viewmaster, you'll understand in a few.

Pro:
Looks great even on crappy settings
I managed to get 3D (ish) in a Holmes & Viewmaster scope .... suck it technology.  OK it was painful and probably not realistic for most people
Very good potential
Looks like crapple people can run this as well ... now for penguin people?

Push:
Very early in the early access - lets hope this is still being developed in a year's time

Con:
Not much of a game, more of a walking sim at this point.


Overall:
Yikes, how do I rate this game?

5/10 (+1 looks, +1 VR, -3 alpha early access) = 4/10

If you have the hardware and want to be part of the early access, there is no question get this.
Otherwise, give it a few months and try then.
I hate to do this but as of today I have to give it a very small thumbs down. I'll check back in 6+ months and hopefully things are more beta than alpha.


Frost Earth Studio: please put up a demo if you get the chance. Many of us are wary of EAGs (and for good reason since there is a lot of crappy EAGs on steam).  I think if DK2 owners could get a taste of the game they may be more likely to buy.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

One of those uncompelling VR purchases.

I'm all for tons of VR, more than I can even play. When a new title on Steam announces it has VR support, I normally investigate and see if it will work with the DK2 (Yes, beware as Valve is too incompetent to properly label VR titles; you must do your own verifications in order to make sure the game actually works with VR, even if Steam says it should... it may very well not - Steam just want to take your money)

While this title worked virtually perfectly with the DK2, content-wise it fell short. Very short. Don't get me wrong, it looks fairly good in there (fairly, not incredibly... I was more impressed with the visuals in Frontiers) but it just doesn't seem right. The scales are off, the LOD lacks and as a showstopper, some basics like camera clipping values are wrong.

I stopped my run when I recognized something I learned in Unity on day 1: I could see a big diamond-shaped hole in the skybox. So we didn't change our default Oculus camera rig values. Hum. Quit.

I regret this purchase. I find it alarming to read things like must own for DK2 users". Your bar must be so low in the must have dept."
voteText: 2 of 5 people (40%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Early Access Review

The game is very cool, my fav place is the master's home, but I love how huge the desert is.

The special powers are cool, especially the magic shield, but with the DK2 i enjoyed all the effects in general.
I got back to the cave trying to find other portals but haven't found any yet. Can't wait to explore the rest though.
Today i'm gonna check it out again to see if i can find the next portal.

Overall, a must have for the DK2 owners!
